reviews.text: Every moment you're not smiling during this movie, you're probably laughing...

I like to think that if this was released now, it would be torn apart by audiences, rather than just a few critics. I like to think it would be roundly rejected and would inspire frequent think pieces that were also full of recommendations of what you should watch instead.

But then I remember Green Book won best picture and that this filmâ€™s overt popularity is because it gives the people what they want. It gives them the stereotype ofâ€¦

In its lightest moments, this film works as a solid buddy comedy. Omar Sy and FranÃ§ois Cluzet have excellent comedic chemistry, which makes all of their loose hangout scenes pretty fun and amusing â€” the scene where Sy takes down classical music and the shaving sequence are particular standouts.

All attempts at genuine dramatic weight, however, fall completely flat. There is not nearly enough time dedicated to either character arc, so their problems never feel particularly pressing or real. Theâ€¦
I find it hard to believe this super rich paraplegic that's into extreme sports had never tried marijuana prior to hiring his one black friend.
